Title.evidence: Effects of Dexmedetomidine on Postoperative Recovery in Elderly TKA Patients: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: In this single-center, randomised controlled trial, 225 patients aged 60 years or older undergoing elective TKA were enrolled

Participants.evidence: 225 patients aged 60 years or older undergoing elective TKA

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned in a 1:1:1 ratio to receive 0.6 μg/kg/h dexmedetomidine (Group D2), 0.3 μg/kg/h dexmedetomidine (Group D1), or saline (Group N)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effects of different doses of dexmedetomidine on postoperative quality of recovery (QoR)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the QoR-15 score on postoperative day 1

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors were blinded

Number_Randomised.evidence: 225 patients aged 60 years or older undergoing elective TKA were enrolled between December 2022 and June 2023

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 204 patients were analysed

Result_Outcome.evidence: Group D2 showed a significant improvement in QoR-15 scores on postoperative day 1 compared to Group N (median difference, 6 points; 95% CI, 4 to 8; P < 0.001)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar across groups
